intro: Minuartia glomerata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant has a mat-forming habit with slender, often hairy stems and small, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its smooth, glabrous leaves distinguish it from other varieties within the species.
